ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gɔɔn mbwó Saẅi ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la túm pɔ́ wɔ́ɔn ngie n zɔ́ʼɔ gú, ńdɔg gÿo fùɔ pà Ésàlayɛ pie ée pʉ̀a pé. Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, júʼu nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn.
en: Samuel told Saul, “The Lord sent me to anoint you as king over his people Israel.   Now, listen to the words of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n zǎb ngie epʉ̀a Amalɛg ge tÿó mmó gie pɔ́ la gÿo na pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, á na páʼ pɔ́ la táte mánzsè wɔ̀b, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ la ne fóo Egíbtò ńkẅɛɛ.
en: This is what the Lord of Armies says: ‘I witnessed   what the Amalekites did to the Israelites when they opposed them along the way as they were coming out of Egypt.  # 15:2 Ex 17:8–16; Nm 24:20; Dt 25:17–19

ngiemboon: Gʉa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ Amalɛg, ḿbiŋ ḿbú ḿbyága kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa yé: ɔ̀ te nyé kwaʼ twó mbùm yé wɔ́; ɔ̀ ge zẅé mbàŋa, é zẅé panzwě, é zẅé gubé mbɔɔ pie é nyé ńnóŋo pɔ́ lepʉ́, é zẅé mefòŋ, é zẅé menjʉ̀njÿò lâ mvfó, é zẅé mekamɛɛ tà mbɔɔ menzikáasè.»
en: Now go and attack the Amalekites and completely destroy everything they have.   Do not spare them. Kill men and women, infants and nursing babies, oxen and sheep, camels and donkeys.’ ”  # 15:3 Jos 6:17–21; 1Sm 22:19

ngiemboon: Saẅi la pú ńcúʼte menùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù ntsèm á Telayim, ésáŋa wɔ́b: palÿɔ́ʼncù laa pʉ̀a ntsáʼ nkÿo pʉ́a, tá ḿbiŋ ńgÿo mbàŋa ye Yúndà, ntsáʼ legém.
en: Then Saul summoned the troops and counted them at Telaim: two hundred thousand foot soldiers and ten thousand men from Judah.

ngiemboon: Saẅi la tó tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Amalɛg, ńnuŋe nzòŋ, á tsɛ̀ɛ kòon.
en: Saul came to the city of Amalek and set up an ambush in the wadi.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né pʉ̀a Keni ngie: «Pi gʉate, pi sẅɛʼte nnɛ́, pi fó tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Amalɛg ńkẅɛ. À cʉa púʼu, ń de púte gẅí lâ pɔ̌ ḿbyág wɔ́. Mélàʼmie pi la gẅiin pòŋontʉ́m nzèm púɔ Ésàlayɛ ntsèm, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ la fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ.» Epʉ̀a Keni la leen ńké fó tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Amalɛg ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́.
en: He warned the Kenites,   “Since you showed kindness to all the Israelites when they came out of Egypt,  # 15:6 Ex 18:9–10; Nm 10:29–32 go on and leave! Get away from the Amalekites, or I’ll sweep you away with them.” So the Kenites withdrew from the Amalekites.

ngiemboon: Saẅi lÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Amalɛg tà ńjÿó, léfó Avila, ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe Shûu gẅie áa shÿó sǎʼnèm we ngwòŋ Egíbtò.
en: Then Saul struck down the Amalekites   from Havilah  # 15:7 Gn 16:7; 25:17–18 all the way to Shur,  # 15:7 Ex 15:22; 1Sm 27:8 which is next to Egypt.

ngiemboon: À la gwoon Agag gẅie à laa fùɔ pà Amalɛg pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀. Ḿbiŋ ḿbú ńzẅéte láʼ ntsèm.
en: He captured King Agag   of Amalek alive, but he completely destroyed all the rest of the people with the sword.  # 15:8 1Sm 27:8; 30:1; 2Sm 8:12

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Saẅi pâ láʼ yé la peʼe Agag, tà mbɔɔ menɔ̀ɔn pé pembòŋo, pâ menjʉ̀njÿò, mbɔɔ mvfó lâ mefòŋ, ńgÿo menɔ̀ɔn pie nzẅìŋ laa mǒ. Pɔ́ la leʼe shúm sie é laa mbòŋ, ńzẅéte pie é la te na tsɔ́ mmó kuʼ.
en: Saul and the troops spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, goats, cattle, and choice animals,   as well as the young rams and the best of everything else. They were not willing to destroy them, but they did destroy all the worthless and unwanted things.

ngiemboon: Ngyè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgɔɔn mbwó Samîɛ ngie:
en: Then the word of the Lord came to Samuel,

ngiemboon: «N ne ḿmÿɔgɔ na páʼ n da lɔgɔ Saẅi ńgÿo fùɔ, mélàʼmie à kéen fó nzèm mèŋ ńgʉa, tà à cʉʼʉ́ ńgiŋe na mánzsè wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.» Anò la ńgyáŋa Samîɛ tà á láʼa láʼ na wɛ̌ letsẅɛ́ʼ pɔ́ légaʼte mbwó Ssé.
en: “I regret that I made Saul king,   for he has turned away from following me and has not carried out my instructions.”  # 15:11 1Kg 9:6–7 So Samuel became angry and cried out to the Lord all night.  # 15:11 Ex 32:11–13; Lk 6:12

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gÿo ńdu ssé tsɛ̀ɛ mbaʼámbaʼ légʉa ńgyá Saẅi. Tá mé shwóŋo yé ngie: Saẅi ně ńgʉa né Kamɛɛ, ńkúu wó, ḿbwóon tsɔ̌ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ, tà fʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, á gíŋe ńcwóŋ né Ngilengaa.
en: Early in the morning Samuel got up to confront Saul, but it was reported to Samuel, “Saul went to Carmel   where he set up a monument for himself. Then he turned around and went down to Gilgal.”  # 15:12 1Sm 13:13–14

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Saẅi, Saẅi ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a néŋ mbʉ́lè na gù! N gÿǒ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn.»
en: When Samuel came to him, Saul said, “May the Lord bless you.   I have carried out the Lord’s instructions.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gɔɔn ngie: «Ngyè nùɔ menjʉ̀njÿò lâ ye mefòŋ gie é pége metuŋó mɔ́ɔn lɔɔn, e fóo nzɔ̌?»
en: Samuel replied, “Then what is this sound of sheep, goats, and cattle I hear? ”

ngiemboon: Saẅi tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Mé ně ńdɔg fó láʼa pʉ̀a Amalɛg: aláʼ ně ḿbeʼe nùɔ menjʉ̀njÿò lâ mefòŋ pie é nyé mbòŋ, légwɔ́ gie mé ge lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù; peg ně ńzẅéte pfwɔ̀ʼ.
en: Saul answered, “The troops brought them from the Amalekites and spared the best sheep, goats, and cattle in order to offer a sacrifice to the Lord your God,   but the rest we destroyed.”  # 15:14–15 Ex 32:21–24

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gɔɔn né Saẅi ngie: «Á kǔʼ pɛ́ʼɛ̀! N ge shwóŋo gú mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ně ńgɔɔn né mèŋ letsẅɛ́ʼ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.» Saẅi gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Gɔɔn la!»
en: “Stop! ” exclaimed Samuel. “Let me tell you what the Lord said to me last night.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gɔɔn ngie: «Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, ɔ̀ gwɔ́ ndÿò ɔ̀ te zsé; ɔ̀ piŋ ngwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fùɔ na mengẅɛ̀ ndá pa Ésàlayɛ, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ ka zɔ́ʼɔ gú ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ.
en: Samuel continued, “Although you once considered yourself unimportant,   haven’t you become the leader of the tribes of Israel? The Lord anointed you king over Israel

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gwaa túmo gú, ńgɔɔn ngie: Gʉa ńzẅéte pʉ̀a Amalɛg ŋwɛ́ pie ée megàŋ mefʉa. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo lÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b né ncù, é pyága wɔ́b tà shʉŋte.
en: and then sent you on a mission and said, ‘Go and completely destroy the sinful Amalekites. Fight against them until you have annihilated them.’

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ka te júʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́ mélàʼakɔ́? Ɔ̀ la gwaa gwe na shúm sie mé lɔ̌g fó ncù, é káa, ńdɔgɔ púʼu ńgÿo mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a te kwoŋ mélàʼakɔ́?»
en: So why didn’t you obey the Lord? Why did you rush on the plunder   and do what was evil in the Lord’s sight? ”

ngiemboon: «Saẅi tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó Samîɛ ngie: N da cwoŋo ńjúʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńcʉ́me na mánzsè gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la túmo wɔ́ɔn mǒ. N da zẅéte pʉ̀a Amalɛg tà ńnyé ndàʼ Agag gẅie aa fùɔ wɔb gẅie n da lɔg ńtó né jʉʼɔɔn;
en: “But I did obey the Lord! ” Saul answered.   “I went on the mission the Lord gave me: I brought back King Agag of Amalek, and I completely destroyed the Amalekites.

ngiemboon: táʼ, palÿɔ́ʼncù pɔ́ɔn la peʼe menjʉ̀njÿò mie ée mbòŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgʉa na mefòŋ pie mé la ne ńgee ńzẅé, ńkẅile mie é fáŋte. É laa púʼu, ńgwɔ́ lélɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù, á Ngilengaa.»
en: The troops took sheep, goats, and cattle from the plunder #— #the best of what was set apart for destruction #— #to sacrifice to the Lord your God at Gilgal.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gíŋe gɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a aa péʼe ńkwoŋ shúm pwɔʼ sie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm kà metsɔ́ mentí lenùŋe pwɔʼ ńcʉa nò léjúʼ ncwò wé keen? Ngǎŋ á gʉa na yé, mbà lejǔʼ ncwò wé, à poŋ ńcʉa lélɔg njʉ̀njÿò gie e pu fáŋ, ńnuŋe pwɔʼ.
en: Then Samuel said:

ngiemboon: Mélàʼmie lelʉʼʉ léjúʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a giŋé ḿbÿɔ́g pɔ́ páʼ légʉa ńgyá patsɔ́ʼngɔ̌ɔn, lelʉʼʉ lézẅíŋe mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a á gíŋe ḿbÿɔ́g pɔ́ páʼ leguʼte metútú. Páʼ ɔ̀ ka gwáʼ mentÿɔgɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la, kwaʼ yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a à gwaʼá gú jú: ɔ̀ te gíŋ gwɔ́ fùɔ gẅie à sáʼa pʉ̀a pé wɔ́.»
en: For rebellion is like the sin of divination,

ngiemboon: «Á cʉa púʼu, Saẅi gɔɔn né Samîɛ ngie: N ka fʉa; n ka lʉʼʉ léjúʼ ncwò Ssé tà mbɔɔ shwóŋè jú. N da ne ḿbɔ́gɔ nÿɔ́g láʼ, ńcʉ́ʼ ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie pɔ́ la ne ńkwoŋo.
en: Saul answered Samuel, “I have sinned.   I have transgressed the Lord’s command  # 15:24 Pr 29:25; Is 51:12–13 and your words. Because I was afraid of the people, I obeyed them.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, mèŋ sẅíŋte gú ngie ɔ̀ lege nò tepòŋ yɔ́ɔn, gíŋe ńtó pɔ̀gɔ zɔ pú ńgwɔ́, n deen ńké ńgʉa ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.»
en: Now therefore, please forgive my sin   and return with me so I can worship the Lord.”

ngiemboon: «Samîɛ gɔɔn mbwó Saẅi ngie: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ ń de cʉ́me nzèm gù wɔ́. Mélàʼmie ɔ̀ kéen ńgwáʼa shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gwáʼa gú, ɔ̀ te gíŋe ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ wɔ́.»
en: Samuel replied to Saul, “I will not return with you. Because you rejected the word of the Lord,   the Lord has rejected you from being king over Israel.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gwɔ́ tà sele nnɛ́ ńne ńgee, Saẅi gwoon nzèm nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye, é shʉa.
en: When Samuel turned to go, Saul grabbed the corner of his robe, and it tore.

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a shʉaté lefùɔ Ésàlayɛ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, éfó mbwó gù ńkẅé, ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ gẅie aa mbòŋ ńcʉa gú.
en: Samuel said to him, “The Lord has torn the kingship of Israel away from you today   and has given it to your neighbor who is better than you.  # 15:27–28 1Kg 11:30–36

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie aa legúʼ we pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, à te cÿɔ nò wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ké te kúbe nkwaŋá wé páʼ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́.»
en: Furthermore, the Eternal One of Israel   does not lie or change his mind, for he is not man who changes his mind.”  # 15:29 Nm 23:19; Ezk 24:14

ngiemboon: Saẅi gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «N ka fʉa! Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, mèŋ sẅíŋte gú, gÿo mekùʼ mɔ́ɔn á mvfò mekěm láʼ pɔ́ɔn, tà mbɔɔ mvfò pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ; cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ pɔ̀gɔ gwɔ́, n deen ńké ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù.»
en: Saul said, “I have sinned. Please honor me   now before the elders of my people and before Israel. Come back with me so I can bow in worship to the Lord your God.”  # 15:30 Is 29:13

ngiemboon: Samîɛ cʉ́me nzèm Saẅi, á gʉa ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Then Samuel went back, following Saul, and Saul bowed down to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, Samîɛ gɔɔn ngie: «Pi lɔgɔ Agag gẅie aa fùɔ pà Amalɛg ńtó.» Agag tó né mvfò yé té pɔ́g. À la ne ńkwaŋa ngie: «Á lɔɔn te gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, mbà nò lékwé té nyé na mèŋ wɔ́.»
en: Samuel said, “Bring me King Agag of Amalek.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gɔɔn ngie: «Ɔ̀ la lɔg nně ncù, ńgÿo panzwě pyé penkʉ́ pɔ́b;
en: Samuel declared:

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gʉa né Lámà, Saẅi pʉ yé né mbʉ̀a yé á Ngimbeya.
en: Samuel went to Ramah,   and Saul went up to his home in Gibeah  # 15:34 1Sm 11:4 of Saul.

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gwaa kwé, mbà à laa gíŋe ńgyá Saẅi wɔ́, tà fó lyɛ̌ʼ gie pɔ́ yé la fege; Samîɛ lɔ̌ɔn ńzɔɔn ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńnéŋe, ḿmÿɔgɔ mÿɔg ńtí Saẅi: kwaʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la zɔɔn ḿmÿɔgɔ mmó gie á la gÿo, á lɔgɔ Saẅi ńgÿo fùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ.
en: Even to the day of his death, Samuel never saw Saul again.   Samuel mourned for Saul,  # 15:35 1Sm 16:1 and the Lord regretted he had made Saul king over Israel.
